data_management module

data_management.load_data(filename)[source]

Load data from a JSON file.

This function reads the specified file and loads the data as a dictionary. If the file does not exist or contains invalid JSON, it handles the errors gracefully and returns an empty dictionary.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The name of the file to load data from.

Returns:

The loaded data if the file is valid, or an empty dictionary if the file is not found or contains invalid JSON.

Return type:

dict

Exceptions:

  • Handles FileNotFoundError if the file doesn’t exist.

  • Handles json.JSONDecodeError if the file contains invalid JSON.

data_management.save_data(filename, data)[source]

Save data to a JSON file.

This function takes a dictionary or list and saves it as a JSON file with the specified filename.

Parameters:

  • filename (str) – The name of the file where the data will be saved.

  • data (dict or list) – The data to be saved into the file.

Actions:

  • Writes the data to the file in JSON format.

data_management.validate_age(age)[source]

Validate if the provided age is non-negative.

This function checks if the provided age is greater than or equal to zero.

Parameters:

age (int) – The age to validate.

Returns:

True if the age is valid (non-negative), False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

data_management.validate_email(email)[source]

Validate if the provided email follows a proper email format.

This function uses a regular expression to check if the given email has a valid format, which includes characters before and after the ‘@’ symbol and a domain.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email address to validate.

Returns:

True if the email format is valid, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
